website_summaries.verdict: Mac users in the market for a new touchpad should buy the Magic Trackpad 2 without a second thought for its advanced force sensors, extra-large surface, and extended battery life.
pros: Responds to various levels of pressure for extra functionality
Available in silver and space gray
cons: Although this is clearly a premium touchpad, it is exclusively compatible with the Mac operating system

customer_reviews.title: USED!!!!!!!!! beware
customer_reviews.text: I never leave comments nor complain, but this was supposed to be brand new. Came in a new box, packaging looked new and it actually took me a few days to realize, but there was a crack near the end on the trackpad where a piece of the clear plastic had been chipped off. Almost unnoticeable. Be careful and make sure that you inspect the product!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Tyler Olinger

customer_reviews.title: Not made by Apple as claimed!
customer_reviews.text: It worked really well until about 1 year ago (confirmed 2016 purchase) then the internal battery started to swell and the whole track pad rocked on its base making pressing to 'click' impossible. When I tried to use Apple's offer of a replacement for defective batteries at a nominal cost they told me the serial number on it's base showed it was a forgery It was not manufactured by Apple and they could not help.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Really smooth on iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a 2018 12.9" iPad pro and it is really smooth and responsive. I've never been much of a trackpad fan for laptops but I wanted to give this a try with the iPad (I also use a mouse with it). I have been impressed with how well this works. The size is nice - I looked at the Magic Keyboard but the trackpad is too small and I like to be able to place the trackpad to the side of a keyboard. Like all else Apple, it's pricey but well executed.
customer_reviews.author: DaveS

customer_reviews.title: Returned item. Registered under someone's name and MISSING CABLE
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed to have received a returned item that is still registered under someone else's name in which they did not return the charging cable in the box! I need this track pad and it does not make sense for me to send it away and wait for a new one but I'm really upset this is the quality of product to receive from the certified Apple account.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well for iPadOS 13.4!
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this to use on my iPad, with the new mouse support. As usual it came in an amazing box, and included the trackpad and a lightning cable. It is very pretty, and is an all glass surface. The fake “click” works so well that you really can’t tell the difference. Tracking precision is the best on any trackpad I’ve used, and there is no lag when connected. Bluetooth setup was easy too. Battery life is stellar too. I’ve used this for about 4 hours a day for 3 weeks, and the battery is at 96%. This is definitely perfect for those who want the new magic keyboard but don’t want to get a new iPad!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Niiice. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I should've gotten this a long time ago. This is a awesome piece of device. The accuracy is great. The best part is you don't need any Bluetooth dongles anymore to connect with macs. Turn it on and you are good to go. The battery life is good. On an average usage ( roughly 4-5 hrs/day or more), it could last me 3 months +. I took a chance ang got it a little cheaper from the Amazon wear house deals..glad I did. It was just as new.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sood

customer_reviews.title: Received a Used Product, DO NOT BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok now I confirmed this is a used product. I googled and found that the packaging is different with the new trackpads, obviously pre-opened. All the protection films were already removed. I am going to return this one. ********************************Original Review************************************ The box is dirty when arrives, and it has a long and thick scratch in the bottom, doesn't look like new for me. i don't know what to say... The product itself if nice, work as good as other apple trackpad i have used.
customer_reviews.author: ChenZiwei

customer_reviews.title: Broken on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Connected but didn't actually work. Called Apple Support. After an hour and a half, they determined it was broken but there were far too many signs that pointed to a problem with the computers clinging to some old version of the trackpad. I don't trust their peripherals now so this gets a 1 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased to see Apple designed this trackpad with internal, rechargeable batteries. The time between charges is greatly increased from the earlier generation that required changing out the batteries. I have had this trackpad for over two months and have rechared it once when it was at 40%. Love the new space gray color it comes in now too!
customer_reviews.author: JDickson

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect directly to mac
customer_reviews.text: Without a special cable (lightning to usbc), or a usbc to usb hub, this cannot be wired to the mac. Who would buy this product that is NOT in the Apple ecosystem. Huge miss on Apple’s part! Those asking why would you do this? It is because that way you don’t have to think about recharging this. You just get in the habit of connecting it to the computer, and if you forget, well you remember when the battery is low.
customer_reviews.author: SI

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap ! I had a magic track pad that came with my iMac for 6 years of reliable use and then it became erratic. So, I spend $115.00for this thing that is not much better. I have to keep tapping on it till a cursor arrow appears on my screen. Till then, I move my finger around on the pad and different pages on my desk top appear and change. Arrow disappears, then play around trying to get it back on the screen.Very frustrating. I don't look forward to buying my next Apple computer if this is a harbinger of their new quality standard.
customer_reviews.author: frugal3

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, functional
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reason for getting this item was to maintain the multi finger functionality on the macbook's built in trackpad. Pro: excellent way of maintaining the same gesture/controls from the macbook's trackpad. It's thin and would pack well for travels. Cons: I'm not certain if this would do better for travels over a mouse but for office use, it's excellent. I have not used this long enough to comment on the charge/battery, however it was very easy to setup. It includes a lighting usb cable and using that for the first time, the laptop setup is complete. once charged, you can use while plugged in or unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: Artemis

customer_reviews.title: Yay! This baby works on Windows 10!
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving this Apple Magic Trackpad! No more arching my hand to use a mouse. It’s helping tremendously with the hand pain/ arthritis I was experiencing. I use Windows 10 on a Dell laptop. By using Magic Utilities’ software, the trackpad works like a charm for me! After 20 years of almost daily mouse use, and surgery to remove a ganglion cyst from my wrist, my hand needed some TLC. I’m so glad I finally bought this thing!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Happytime
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement for my 6 year old Apple Magic Mouse that wasn't working properly anymore. I decided to give the trackpad a go - and I'm glad I did. The gestures (swiping, scrolling, etc.) are intuitive and easily accomplished. For me, it is much more comfortable than a mouse (that always seem to be the wrong size, the wrong weight, the buttons in the wrong place - hey, maybe my hands are the wrong shape!), and I love that you can 'click' with your fingers anywhere on the pad, and it responds easily to a gentle touch. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: awesome trackpad in linux
customer_reviews.text: this trackpad works great in linux. it works fine w/ the synaptics driver but works fantastic with mtrack. using libinput-gestures the multitouch gestures work great and are fully scriptable. it works both via bluetooth or as a normal WIRED USB DEVICE! (i dont see this advertised anywhere and wasn't expecting it) i personally love the ability to just use it wired. it's always charged and has no latency. my only gripe is the finish. no matter what you do your fingers are leave marks. i saw another comment shilling a certain site, i ordered a custom one and it's so nice i have to say: a sticker from decalgirl.com is required to properly use this device ;D
customer_reviews.author: xeR0

customer_reviews.title: Make a real ergonomic difference over the former Magic Trackpad
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using the former Magic trackpad for years. I'm fine with mine, though I engineered a riser with gel wrist rest to control the various angles. In her case they've sat unangled on a keyboard tray. Her old one finally broke and we replaced with model 2. Which to our surprise is noticeably more ergonomic because it requires less force to click...probably due to the availability of additional gestures under the latest Mac OS's that differentiate pressure as well as number of fingertips. So a big win for those with hand/wrist/arm issues of the carpel and related varieties.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Windrum

customer_reviews.title: First one I received was not new and broke after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working today. When I received it it had somebody's name/computer , so it was obviously used. False advertising - not new! Update - Amazon got me new one the same day. The new one I received was new & has worked great. I'm not sure why the first one broke after just over 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very precise and satisfying to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy on my wrists too, which is why I decided to try it. I was getting a serious case of "mouse-pad burn". I'm still keeping a mouse online for precision tasks, although this may change after I have practiced more with the Trackpad. Scrolling vertically or horizontally is a breeze - that's one of the best features. Highlighting or dragging takes two hands on the pad, one to click and hold, the other to drag, although i haven't tried experimenting with drag-lock yet. I'm learning to use the Trackpad left handed pretty quickly, which gives my right hand a nice break.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Legitimate Apple Product
customer_reviews.text: Love the color. I'm getting used to the ergonomics testing different positions and gestures but it's not a silver bullet. I would not recommend this for gaming, CAD or anything requiring precision mouse movements - but for the day to day work it's great. Battery life is mediocre but quick to recharge via lighting cable you're likely to have lying around (not included) if you're bought into the Apple ecosystem. The aesthetic is a bit better than any ergo mouse or trackball I've used - but also worth experimenting with to make sure the ergonomics work for you.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: It works great!!! I love it! Battery life is unbelievable- 4 weeks without a charge!!! Only complaint is the DAMN price is way too high!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E.

customer_reviews.title: Very natural haptic click with variable pressure
customer_reviews.text: This trackpad is superior in every way to the previous generation Apple trackpad. The best feature of this trackpad is that the pressure required to click is even throughout the entire pad, different from the previous generation which used a mechanical diving board to click. The click pressure is also variable in system preferences. The audible click sound can be turned on or off in settings. Haptic vibration motor for the click feels very natural and satisfying. Built-in battery lasts very long. I have not had to charge in over a month. Highly recommend this trackpad if you want the best of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Drummer52895

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement to magic trackpad one.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the magic trackpad one for some time but was never a fan due to its bulky design and not so great feedback. Due to work from home situation, thought would be a great upgrade to try and decided to buy this. I should say I am super pleased. The battery life is amazing. (No more stupid batteries) . Also the product by itself feels sold. Force touch works amazing and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Swapnil Shah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, exceed expectation despite the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after reading the reviews that it felt like using the Macbook pro trackpads. Yes it is true and I couldn't believe it when I started using it. I own the previous gen one and this version blows that one out of the water. In fact I doubt I could use any other trackpad after my fingers have been spoiled by this one. My only con is the price. It's a bit too high and I believe maybe $99 for this item seems a bit more fair but its up to Apple. I would buy a second one in a heartbeat if this one breaks down.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - worth every dollar
customer_reviews.text: I'd been struggling with long hours at my desk - and decided to move my laptop onto a stand to make a more ergonomic position for my arms and neck. This made my track pad unusable. I tried an apple mouse - but missed the ease of the trackpad. This remote trackpad is amazing - in that it wirelessly and perfectly replace the built in trackpad. I have a wireless keyboard and wireless trackpad now - that I can move around to best ergonomic position. Easy to use, automatic connection to mac, easy to clean, stays charged for many days... Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Reichel

customer_reviews.title: It is better than a mouse, much better than Apple's magic mouse
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about trackpad usability and waited a few years to finally tried it out. It is a great tracking device, better than a wired mouse I use currently, and much better than Apple's magic mouse. Because it supports gestures for features like select, drag, etc. It makes these used to be hard to use feature for trackpad simple to use. The size is right, not too small, not too large. I do feel a wrist rest is a must to it. I use a round pebble which is 40 mm wide and 20 mm high.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: It's NOT silver, it's WHITE, and incompatible with older OS X versions
customer_reviews.text: It's NOT silver, it's WHITE, and incompatible with older OS X versions Sneaky apple purposely shot the photo at an extreme angle to hide the fact that the touch surface is WHITE and not silver like the original magic trackpad! Not only that, it is shiny scratchable acrylic PLASTIC, not matte faux metal like the original. Sellers actually sell a metal decal to hide this but who would pay for that? It is just a veneer. Also, this newer trackpad is incompatible with older OS X versions. I couldn't use it with my old Mac Pro. It does work on my wife's new iMac though. And the price. Are you kidding? $123.99 for what should be $40 tops.
customer_reviews.author: Zhu Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with everything apple
customer_reviews.text: Yeah I know it wasn't designed for an ipad, but you would think that since they added mouse support to an ipad, they would integrate the magic pad. You can connect it to an ipad but it will only work as a point and click device and that is it. It won't do gestures. So, in my case it would be great to be able to use it when I connect my Ipad to the dasung eink monitor, then I would have gestured through the magic pad. So, that is just one use case where that would work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Howard

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy - Unprecise
customer_reviews.text: I bought the original Apple track pad via amazon. Fresh out of the box, original seal. Brand new. First, it worked great. Now, 1 month in, it has become glitchy, erratic, not tracing movements precisely, having to fumble with the cursor. The track pad is fully charged up (I do it regularly). It never took a fall. Problem persists, no matter if I operate via USB or Bluetooth. It is a totally inferior product. If I would have bought locally at Apple store, I would have returned by now.
customer_reviews.author: Ohrwurm

customer_reviews.title: Used trackpad
customer_reviews.text: This is used trackpad! I was so excited the product until I opened the package, the charging cable is missing!
customer_reviews.author: Wenyin Deng

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection constantly.
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth disconnects at least once per hour. Not sure if it's the trackpad or Mac mini. It reconnects by itself after about 10 seconds and several "disconnecting/Connecting" messages but it's annoying. Especially when it happens right in the middle of needing the pointer. This appears to be an issue with others as my online research indicates. The version 1 of this trackpad never had this issue. (But I don't have it to test on this particular Mac).
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: After using a MacBook Air for so many years, I had become very accustomed to the apple trackpad. This Magic Trackpad 2 is exactly what I needed and what I imagined the product would be like when I ordered. The battery life has been fantastic so far, I am going on over a month of heavy usage and am currently at 35% battery life without recharging.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: I love the multi-touch functionality
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade from the first version trackpad, if you had one. My first version trackpad was having so many issues hopping between computers with multiple bluetooth pairs and I was getting tired of it not working so I ordered this one. I love the multi-touch functionality, and charge with USB functionality as well. Note: I am a programmer so I work from computer 6 hours a day, 5 days a week. Comfort, functionality, and battery life on this new magic trackpad meet and exceed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: I now hate mice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to "see how it worked". I now hate the normal "Magic" mouse. I find myself constantly trying to drag my finger across the top to mouse to no affect. Extremely frustrating needing to ensure I have all this extra space available to "roll" the old archaic mouse around the table. ADDITIONALLY, I can plug this thing in AND use it at the same time, unlike the poorly designed "Magic" mouse that lies on it's back useless like a turtle on a fence post while waiting for the battery to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: mark a mace

customer_reviews.title: Useful but does NOT come with the right cable for new MacBook Pros
customer_reviews.text: I was relieved I have a new iPhone, otherwise I would NOT have had a cable to use this item. They should include an adapter or MAKE IT CLEAR HERE that you need one, or just send a modern cable! Not sure what people do if they don't have this cable. Also, this is definitely WHITE not Silver. I wish there had been an option for the Space Gray version... although it's not really *worth* the money. Just seemed like it might be less likely to show dirt + wear. Anyway, excited to see how this works! :) Just wanted others to know this in advance.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: 5/5, What Else Is New
customer_reviews.text: I've used many Apple Magic Trackpads before and I've loved every single one of them, so when I got this one for my studio desk I knew exactly what I was in for. As expected, it's on the expensive side, but the build quality, packaging quality and smoothness/responsiveness of the Magic Trackpad are unmatched. Great companion for an iMac or MacBook and great paired with the Magic Keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Erik S.

customer_reviews.title: Like it.
customer_reviews.text: Some people have the track pad and some people love it. I for one love it. I have had one ever since the first version and that one was good, but this one is even better. It feels sturdier then the first one (and the one I have still works since 2008ish) and the functionality is so much better. I also like that it’s much bigger and just the over all feeling it it is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Track Pad - Total Continuation of MacBook
customer_reviews.text: Amazing fit & finish. It's light weight but feels solid. Everything functions perfectly and connected within seconds to my MBP. Gestures, force touch, and the settings are totally adjustable to your liking. The foot print is small/compact but you have plenty of new room on your desk. Excellent product - little on the expensive side, but the fit and finish are impeccable.
customer_reviews.author: Overboost

customer_reviews.title: Periodically disconnects for no apparent reason
customer_reviews.text: I am using a brand new MacBook Pro (July 2019). The trackpad will periodically lose connection, reconnect, and lose connection back and forth. It sits 4 inches from the closed laptop (I use a monitor). It days every couple days and it will work correctly 80% of the time. For the high price of the product this is unacceptable. I now have to use a mouse as a back-up so as to not interrupt my workflow. If you are considering whether to purchase or not, and are comfortable with a mouse, I would avoid buying.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fin

customer_reviews.title: George Jetson would approve: It really IS much better than the old trackpad!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised. I bought this just because my old Apple trackpad seemed to be drifting around and lagging, plus I wasn't wild about feeding it batteries all the time. This new one is -- like me -- more sensitive. It's almost as though you just have to think about clicking, rather than actually push your finger down. I know that's an incredibly "First World" distinction, but the point is, you WILL like it. It really is better.
customer_reviews.author: Walter W.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: I broke both my wrists (just call me grace) which required surgery and casts. I wasn't able to use my mouse and still needed to get work done. A client suggested getting a trackpad - what a game changer!! Even though I am recovered now, I am not going back to the mouse. I'm even considering getting a second one for my laptop because it's easier to use for me than the one that comes with the MacBookAir
customer_reviews.author: HippieChick

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY a great trackpad from Apple!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY! Apple made a trackpad that I actual like. After suffering through years of various science experiments from the trackpad team in Cupertino, Apple has hit pay dirt with this. It feels and operatates "naturally" without me having to think about what my fingers are doing. The surface has what feels like haptic feedback and (I've read) that glass actually flexes a bit. Whatever the magic is, Apple has captured it and this is a pleasure to use. I am a software engineer so the tools my fingers use are very important to me. This is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bender

customer_reviews.title: Loses connectivity all the time
customer_reviews.text: Great when it works, but too unreliable for productivity. Loses connectivity to my 2018 mbp all the time. Other bluetooth peripherals work without issue. It got so annoying that it is unusable and I now use an old USB mouse. If you buy one, make sure you return asap as soon as you experience issues because the amazon return window is small. Until I contact Apple to see if I can exchange it that way, it's a $125 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Could use more battery life
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking of switching from an older Magic Trackpad, or from a mouse--don't delay! This is money well spent. I cannot use a mouse on macOS anymore, this trackpad just allows you so much more control over the experience. That being said, the battery life could be better. You only get about a month out of it, whereas the keyboard goes 3-4 months. By the weight of it you'd think there's more battery in the trackpad than the keyboard. One month still isn't too bad though.
customer_reviews.author: George Beecher

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement for an Old Apple Track Pad
customer_reviews.text: The old trackpad had the "jimps" on some sites and the AA batteries could wear down quickly. Bit the bullet and got this new iteration, even though there were some complaints. Works well. Easy to pair up. Some "jimps" but fewer than before and seems to smooth out by attaching the USB for charging for just a minute or so. Sensitive and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Willowisp

customer_reviews.title: Fun swipes, but not ergonomic for tapping or dragging a lot.
customer_reviews.text: It's ergonomic if you do a lot of surfing, but not for typical office work (clicking/tapping, etc.) What makes it not ergonomic is that the surface of the trackpad is not slick and provides a lot of resistance to dragging fingers, especially when precision or repetition is important. Also it's tilted in the wrong direction, but that is remedied by free software that allows you to use it upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Autore

customer_reviews.title: I prefer it over mouse options
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these trackpads. One at work and one at home. They have a nice smooth feel to use. The battery life is a bit shorter than I expected but it's not a problem, it lasts a long time, a month maybe. I use it for general computer use, music recording, UI/UX design. I prefer a mouse for gaming but for everything else, I use these trackpads.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Only apple product I own
customer_reviews.text: I am really not a fan of Apple, but I was looking for a decent trackpad for a Chromebook. The latest release of ChromeOS fully supports it and it's a really nice bit of hardware. Brydge is developing a trackpad for Chrome which will be out later this year. If you want a trackpad this is your best bet. If you are willing to wait, check out the Brydge trackpad if you want to use it on Chrome. Happy with it, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Love it.  you will not be disappointed if upgrading from original.
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement on the previous trackpad. I have both an iMac and a powerbook. For some reason I could never get use using the original track pad with the iMac, always went back the mouse, despite feeling very comfortable with the trackpad on the powerbook. Many issue was when I worked with photos - detailed click, drag and edits seemed hard. This new trackpad (2) is a big jump. It is more sensitive, more natural feeling, and bigger. My mouse has been placed in storage:) If you have the original trackpad and wondering if it is worth the upgrade I would say YES it is.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Eastman

customer_reviews.title: It's super amazing
customer_reviews.text: I must say that this is the most fantastic trackpad. It's as good as MacBook Pro trackpad. I have used Magic Mouse in the past, but I didn't like it because its surface is acrylic glass which doesn't provide a good swipe experience. So, I was not sure about Magic Trackpad either. I called Apple to confirm the material. MacBook Pro's Trackpad and Magic Trackpad 2, both have mate glass finish, while Magic Mouse is acrylic glass finish. It's an amazing trackpad. If you are considering an external trackpad for macOS, You must go for this.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas

customer_reviews.title: It's an Apple Trackpad
customer_reviews.text: You either love them or hate them. My older Magic Mouse, eats batteries, even using rechargeables, I'd replace the batteries every couple days, always when I needed to use it the most. Since I use the trackpad on the laptop when not at my desk, I figured I'd just do the same when at my desk. There are moments, like dragging something across my 30" display can be difficult but overall, very happy with it. Battery is supposed to last 30 days or so, I get about two weeks between charges.
customer_reviews.author: mdisher

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this to work but...
customer_reviews.text: As much as I wanted to love this I couldn’t. I needed something for my wrist pain and thought that this was pretty hard to press down on. Maybe mine was defective but for the price I found it to be expensive for what it offered for me. I might try another one after they drop in price, but for now I will be using a verrücket mouse instead...
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Not even optional
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get this through Amazon for some reason, but as a new iMac user I can say you are missing out if you don't own one. I always used a track ball mouse, so when my Mac Pro arrived with a movable mouse I was willing to try this. I still use the mouse for scrolling, but not much else. This will cover a 27" screen in nothing flat and is very controllable. Thinking of getting one for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: John Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Have it on my work desk and I use it rarely
customer_reviews.text: Not its fault that I don't use it as much as the mouse, it's just difficult to break a habit of 30 years using a mouse. Extramagic is working fine on my Windows 10 PC once I got a working bluetooth dongle for the desktop. It's pretty neat to use to browse the web with but I think it gives more stress to my hand overall for normal daily operations.
customer_reviews.author: Oniomaniac

customer_reviews.title: Not for video or music production
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to save desk space as an audio mixer and thought this would streamline my workflow a bit. Unfortunately it just made work more cumbersome and physically straining compared to a mouse. Recommend for light tasks and everyday use, but not for video or music production. Sent mine back and simply bought a better mouse pad for magic mouse.
customer_reviews.author: bookfiend

customer_reviews.title: It's not as user friendly as my old one
customer_reviews.text: It's very touchy and causes a lot of bouncing around and my fingers are not even touching it! All I have to do is float my fingers over it and all kinds of stuff start popping up! I don't think it works as well or is as nice as my old silver battery operated apple track pad! I'll hang in there with it, but if it continues to act up I will be calling Apple.
customer_reviews.author: robin wooddy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Makes navigating on an iMac sooo much easier! If you have a macbook, it's just like that trackpad. Worth getting, esp if you can find in amazon's warehouse deals like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Coral S.

customer_reviews.title: Improves on an already great design.
customer_reviews.text: The new Trackpad 2 improves upon Apple's already great wireless Trackpad of yore. The new model now includes a Lightning port for charging the internal battery (no more hassle changing batteries out!). This also allows it to be used as a wired USB trackpad so you can use it with machines that don't have Bluetooth capabilities. Taking a hint from the newer MacBooks, the Trackpad 2 includes Force Touch so you can use different pressure levels to perform different tasks in macOS.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton M.

customer_reviews.title: Last 5 weeks on single charge
customer_reviews.text: I use this device heavily and have gotten 5 weeks of use before needing to recharge again. I find the cursor is much better to control when compared to Apple's mouse. I found the right side widget bar can be easily opened by dragging two fingers on the pad one of which must be swiped inward from the right edge. Can't do that with a mouse as far as I know. This device is just more comfortable compared to a mouse in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Has some connection issues,  Keep the Lightning cable close
customer_reviews.text: The Apple Magic Trackpad 2 works perfectly when it wants to work. The bad side to the trackpad is that it does have connection issues. Sometimes it will connect and disconnect multiple times a day. The battery can be fully charged and it will still do that. The only way to fix the issue when the trackpad wants to be difficult is to connect the lightning cable to the trackpad to the computer and it will work directly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It has the same feel as the one's built into the Macbooks
customer_reviews.text: This trackpad gives the same feel as if I'm working on the internal trackpad on a Macbook. I was concerned if it would have the sense of when you do a "click" press and it does have the tactile and even audible feedback of making a mouse click. Very easy to use. Charged it up a week ago and haven't had to recharge it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cydonia Sunset

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I wish it worked with windows PCs as well, but it works great with my 2019 16" Macbook pro. Battery lasts about 2 weeks of constant use. My only complaint, and this is more of a Mac OS issue, is that you can't wake your computer up with this trackpad when it's connected by bluetooth, you have to use a keyboard or plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Bananas

customer_reviews.title: The best trackpad
customer_reviews.text: I hated all trackpads until I used Apple's trackpads. These are really great with intuitive gestures, tactile feedback on click, and no unintended inputs ever. This is the latest version of their trackpad and it's the best one so far. I like to switch it up between mice and trackpads to prevent hand/wrist strain issues
customer_reviews.author: E. Max

customer_reviews.title: too slow for multitask type work
customer_reviews.text: maybe if you are pure software developer, and all you do, 3-finger swipe between couple of desktops - they will work. but for a more multitasking approach, where you do development, shop, browse the web etc.... those are simply too slow with this thing. had them for a month - really tried send them back
customer_reviews.author: Lukas

customer_reviews.title: "Magic" Trackpad 2
customer_reviews.text: I love the Apple Magic Trackpad 2. I use a MacBook Pro docked at work all day and use a Macally Bluetooth solar keyboard and the Apple Magic Trackpad 2 as my input devices all day long. I work on my Mac, but also remote frequently throughout the day into Windows servers and PCs. I love the trackpad and it works well in those environments, too. It really shines when using it on the Mac and using gestures and swiping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomic–but an excellent desk addition and good for video editing
customer_reviews.text: The scrolling is very smooth and responsive, in a typical Apple fashion. It is very good for video editing as you can scrobble the timeline left and right very quickly. Other than that you might have ergonomic issues for normal desk work as you palm is faced down when you use this. I had some minimal wrist issues, but your mileage may vary. I love Apple devices and this aesthetic looks premium though.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Works great unless you want to share it between Macs
customer_reviews.text: The trackpad works really well with a single Mac. The battery life is great. Works and feels just like the one in my MacBook Pro. The only flaw is that it's annoying to switch it from one Mac to another. I use both my work and personal Macs with the same dock at home, which works flawlessly for the wired devices, but this mouse is wireless. I have to remember to disconnect it from one and then repair with the other. I gave up and bought one for each Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Zenk

customer_reviews.title: Apple fan pleased again
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the previous trackpad, I really just wanted everything to be chargeable with the lightning cable. I enjoy the force touch and the other small benefits. the wider space is also a plus. it works beautifully paired with my MacBook and the new bluetooth keyboard as well. I do development and photography so although I try to not use a mouse, some times you just need to, and I prefer a trackpad over a mouse due to my desk setup so I love having a big trackpad in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Apple has done it again
customer_reviews.text: My older trackpad stopped transmitting, so I needed another, and a friend suggested this one. It is much more expensive than I wanted to spend, but it does work well. very light touch, I used to rest my fingers on the other one without selecting, and this one is always responsive. (Sometimes too sensitive.) Excellent product, Apple does it again.
customer_reviews.author: JohnK

customer_reviews.title: If you like the laptop trackpad you'll like this
customer_reviews.text: I moved away from the magic mouse because it was a little small for my hands. This works exactly like a trackpad and it is larger. You'll want to charge every other week or so, but that is if like me you don't like having it fall below 40% battery life. It can be used while charging and charges quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should but could be smaller
customer_reviews.text: It works great. The force touch took some calibrating and getting used to, but once you have that dialed in it works great. I gave it 4 stars because it's a little to big for my use. I position the track pad below the keyboard to mimic my Macbook Air...it's better ergonomically and I can use both hands. If it was smaller like the laptop size, it would be perfect for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great design! And, it comes with a lightning cable.
customer_reviews.text: It came in great condition and was charged to 95% right out of the box. Make sure you toggle the on off switch in the top side of the lightning port. It’s very small and very eaasy to miss. When toggled on you will see a green background behind the switch. Very clean design. I will go ahead and buy the wireless keyboard next pay day.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I am an apple guy but having said that I really hate spending money on their mostly over-priced products. Having said that this really was money well spent and quite frankly priced right. Bought this for my 2012 Mac Mini and it hooked up in a second and worked perfectly.. Warning.. Your Mac must be capable of bluetooth 4.0 or its not going to work with this track pad.
customer_reviews.author: curren

customer_reviews.title: No more hand cramps
customer_reviews.text: My hand cramps up with a regular mouse. I love this new track pad even better than the original. It’s quick & accurate & has a lot of features. Best part is that my hand doesn’t cramp & it just feels natural to use. I love that you can charge this one right from the computer & don’t have to mess with batteries. Charge lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it. I took a gamble getting this
customer_reviews.text: I have the Magic Mouse 2 and honestly, I don't like it. I took a gamble getting this, the price is not cheap... but wow, it is amazing. I don't think I'll ever use a mouse again. Really nice... responsive, large surface area. I thought it'd be awkward not using a mouse, but it is liberating.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good for almost every use case
customer_reviews.text: Apple makes the best trackpads, no denying that. Gestures are amazing. For most general work, this is the best pointing device. For producing in a DAW, half the time I wish it was just a regular mouse. It is most challenging to use when dragging elements across my screen. If you push too hard and accidentally engage the second “click”, sometimes it has an erratic effect on the operation you’re performing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hilk

customer_reviews.title: A truly great trackpad.
customer_reviews.text: The only way to go. I received my Apple Magic Trackpad 2 yesterday. I recently purchased a 27" iMac from Amazon and a Magic Mouse was included. I do a lot of Photoshop on my computers and found the mouse to be a little tedious. I set it up as fast as if would go and still found that I was "mousing" all over my desk. The Trackpad 2 solved the problem. It is very fast and you can cover the entire screen without moving your arm. May not sound like much but it is. Try one.
customer_reviews.author: HLA

customer_reviews.title: The mouse is dead !
customer_reviews.text: 3/15/17 Expand your Mac experience with this marvelous navigation control. I had enjoyed Master MX and Performance mice ( all failed ), but this is definitely the cat's meow ! Just have to remember which one/two/three finger swipe/sweep/up/down gestures do what. Apple's TrackPad 2 introductory video displayed in system preferences demonstrates perhaps fifteen gestures. I have mastered perhaps four which is all I really need.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar R. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Seems to generate inputs even when no contact is made.
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this in combination with the wireless keyboard while programming using the BulletTrain keyboard platform but there seemed to be some interference between the two. Even when I didn't actually touch the trackpad, I would get random inputs where my cursor would move randomly. This obviously made the combination useless and frustrating for programming. I never had this issue with the original version of the Magic Trackpad. So this was just a clear waste of $120.00.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Neiman

customer_reviews.title: Works, but could be a bit more smooth/precise...
customer_reviews.text: I recently started using a Mac mini instead of my old MacBook Pro. I really liked the trackpad on my MacBook Pro and wanted something similar for the desktop. Unfortunately, it isn’t as natural for me to use this one as it was to use the trackpad on a MacBook Pro. I have adjusted the tracking/speed settings, but have trouble making fine selections, etc. it’s a little jerky sometimes... not as smooth and precise as my old 2011 MBP trackpad. Hopefully it’s just me needing more time to adjust acclimate.
customer_reviews.author: clubirv

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my 2018 iPad Pro 12.9". I love this trackpad. It feels like the trackpad on my 2015 MacBook Pro. Lovely device. I also own the Magic Trackpad 1 and this one puts it to shame in terms of surface area, looks and the fact that you can click anyplace on this Magic Trackpad 2.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and better...
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Apple Trackpad (have the original too). I like this better than the first because of size, and the surface is smoother. Since I learned to go to System prefs-->Accessibility-->Trackpad options, and turn on the triple finger drag, all my trackpad devices work better. I like the larger size of this unit for when I need to move/drag items. I like the recharge ability for the reason I hate changing batteries in keyboards, mice and trackpads. I like the higher price because it means it will be serviceable for a long time, and not be considered a throw-away should an issue arises (and Apple has the best service in the world when it comes to repair/replace/warranty issues).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apple Magic Trackpad 2
customer_reviews.text: I am not ready to give a completely fair review at this time, as I am still learning how to use all it’s features. I know with time it will become more user friendly. In the past, I used a mouse and trac ball. This is totally different and it’s like teaching an old dog new tricks!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful trackpad lets you speed your computer operations
customer_reviews.text: So many things you do on your Mac can be done more easily with a trackpad instead of a mouse. This large high quality trackpad integrates into the Mac OS flawlessly and enhances many of the program operations in both speed and ease of use. Pairs quickly by plugging in with the lightning cable which is also how you charge it every few months.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Swift

customer_reviews.title: Better than anything available for Windows
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these for my MacBook, and wanted another one for use with Windows 10. There's nothing that comes even close manufactured for Windows specifically but, fortunately, magicutilities.net provides an excellent utility program that makes it possible to use this with Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Ville Walveranta

customer_reviews.title: Frequent Bluetooth disconnections
customer_reviews.text: This trackpad constantly loses connection to Bluetooth throughout the day at least seven or eight times. Other than that I like it but it’s pretty frustrating to get disconnected and have to wait for it to re-establish. There are a lot of people complaining on the Internet about it as well.
customer_reviews.author: TimE Holm

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the mouse if you have iMac
customer_reviews.text: My god. If you are using a 21" or 27" iMac...just get rid of the mouse. This trackpad has saved my arm, wrist, desk...everything. One finger swipe to move my cursor all over the entire 27" screen. I honestly opened the box, turned it, moved my finger across the trackpad and laughed out loud while I tossed the wireless mouse in a drawer to never be seen again. Cannot believe I waited so long to use the Trackpad instead. Absolute game changer.
customer_reviews.author: MikeH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was very unsure about purchasing this given the cost but so far I'm really please with it! I wasn't sure if I was ready to give up a mouse but I truly haven't found myself missing anything a mouse has to offer. The battery life is amazing; I fully charged it when I first received it almost a month ago and use it for my 40 hours a week at work and the battery isn't even halfway dead (65%). It also came very quickly and was very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: exactly what you would expect of this apple product
customer_reviews.text: not sure what to say but its an apple trackpad. Easy to set up and use. great build quality and functionality. battery life lasts me usually a few weeks. (using it about 2-4 hours a day) it is super expensive in my opinion but had no other choice since no other company makes a trackpad this nice.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I have tried using it while being around 11 feet away from my laptop and it still works. Battery life is pretty good too. I have had it for almost a month, never turn it off, and haven't charged it once yet. I don't have any problems right clicking or scrolling.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this purchase! I was on the fence at first and couldn’t decide if I should go with a mouse or a trackpad. I’m glad I choose this trackpad. It’s a good size and offers just the right amount of touch sensitivity. I do love the sense of control this brings to my work flow. It’s very easy to swipe over to other screens, zoom in and out, and much more. I already had a Macbook with a trackpad but this is even better!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Absolute gold.  Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I've been rocking a 2008 Macbook unibody for 10 years, and recently upgraded to the 2018 Mac Mini. The Magic Mouse 2 is nice, but nothing is like the trackpad. I can't believe how much better the trackpad has gotten since the legacy 2008 version. It's butter. Couldn't be happier, other than the price, but I say go for it. Once you try it, you'll be hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get angry, just exchange the broken item!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this particular “used” item from The warehouse did not work at all! I called the company and reported the problem. They told me to return the item. I then bought a “brand new” Apple Trackpad 2 and I’m as happy as can be with my “brand new item.” My trackpad 2 makes navigating on my “brand new” iMac/keyboard/mouse ( bought from Amazon) very easy. I work as an online ESL/ELL teacher. My work station is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda M. Spearman

customer_reviews.title: Great design, no range
customer_reviews.text: I really love this trackpad, but it suffers from frequently dropped connections -- unlike the first generation -- at about 18" from the laptop. (I have an external monitor set up).
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Fanelli

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the used trackpad
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in my "New" trackpad and it says "Paul D Thompson's Trackpad". Problem is... I'm not Paul D Thompson. Never have been. That leaves me with a lot of mixed feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really no improvement over first version - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It's a little wider than the first model and it has internal rechargeable batteries. It has force touch, which I really don't like. The first version uses easily replaceable AA batteries and is less than half the price (as low as twenty-five bucks used). I'm going back to version 1 and getting my money back on this.
customer_reviews.author: Scottiana

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to replace Magic Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Suffer from tendinitis, which use of a mouse aggravates considerably. The Magic Trackpad alleviates the strain. It is overpriced, as everything Apple is, but in my case, worth the expense for the reduction of pain and strain in my wrist and arm. It just works and from the moment I switched it on, paired instantly with my iMac.
customer_reviews.author: ModGrandma

customer_reviews.title: The best trackpad for your Mac but yes, it will cost you
customer_reviews.text: I had the original trackpad but not the original keyboard. After problems with another keyboard, I got the newer Apple keyboard and was so impressed, I got this trackpad to go with it. I've been very happy with that decision and they both work very well together. Yes, this is an expensive purchase. There is no "Amazon Basics" version that you can get for $10. However, it has a great size and "just works" like you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Linger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool you will get hooked to
customer_reviews.text: If you're used to multi finger tasks on your mac's trackpad, this external one is for you. I use the multi finger swipes a lot, so wanted to try this out. The best part is that it's USB-charged, so no haggling with batteries. It's really convenient and is completely configurable. Give it a shot and you wont regret it...
customer_reviews.author: whatsinaname

customer_reviews.title: Works great with windows too!
customer_reviews.text: This works great with windows. I mainly use it on windows as well as my macbook air. I use the software "Magic Trackpad Utilities" which costs 15$ per year but has a lot of nice features. The trackpad is super smooth and pretty huge. I would say it's bigger than any of the macbook pro trackpads actually.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Magic Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This trackpad is great. I was looking for an alternative to the magic mouse. Since I love the trackpad function on my Macbook Pro I was excited that this trackpad had all the same features. (swipe functions, force touch, pinch/pull) It is about a half inch taller than the trackpad on my Macbook, but the same width, it also slopes up so that the top of the trackpad is slightly raised I find that it is more comfortable to use than the flat trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

product_meta.title: Apple Magic Trackpad 2 (Wireless, Rechargable) - Silver
feature_bullets: Magic Trackpad 2 is rechargeable with a built-in battery and brings Force Touch to the desktop for the first time.

Four force sensors underneath the trackpad surface allow you to click anywhere, and detect subtle differences in the amount of pressure you apply, bringing increased functionality to your fingertips and enabling a deeper connection to your content.

Magic Trackpad 2 also features an edge-to-edge glass surface area that is nearly 30 percent larger than the previous trackpad. This design, along with a lower profile, makes scrolling and swiping through your favorite content more productive and comfortable than ever.
Magic Trackpad 2 pairs automatically with your Mac, so you can get to work right away. And the battery will power your Magic Trackpad 2 for about a month or more before needing a recharge.
